w:r.w:t: You are designing the DevOps setup for a multi-tenant website hosting platform.
Users can deploy multiple websites dynamically.
Users can map custom domains on the fly.
CI/CD automates builds, deployments, rollbacks, and event notifications.
Use a sample web app (Node.js, Python Flask).
Deploy 3 user websites in separate namespaces (user1, user2, user3) using Helm or Kubernetes manifests.
Configure Ingress with TLS for all websites automatically.
Implement readiness/liveness probes, resource limits/requests, and network policies.
Use dynamic domain mapping (e.g., user1.example.com, user2.example.com) that can be added without redeploying the cluster.
Short explanation of dynamic domain mapping approach.
2. CI/CD Pipeline with Rollback & Event Trigger
Build pipeline (GitHub Actions / GitLab CI) to:
Deploy automatically to Kubernetes per user namespace.
Logs/screenshots of successful deployment, rollback, and event trigger.
Configure HPA per website based on CPU/memory.
Use resource quotas to enforce limits per user.
Simulate heavy load to demonstrate autoscaling.
Add Prometheus/Grafana dashboards to visualize cluster and website metrics.
Screenshots/logs showing scaling and HPA metrics.
Notes explaining scaling strategy and resource allocation.
Spin up single-node Kafka via Docker.
Integrate event publishing into CI/CD pipeline for automated notifications.
Optional: pipeline YAML showing automated event trigger.
Proof of work: Screenshots or live demo for:
